meanings.definition: The part of a scene or picture that is nearest to the viewer.
meanings.sent1: In the painting, the artist carefully added details to the foregrounds to draw the viewer's attention.
meanings.sent2: The photographer adjusted the focus to capture the beautiful flowers in the foregrounds of the image.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to hide in the foregrounds of the family portrait, photobombing the picture.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors in the foregrounds of the landscape painting popped out, creating a sense of depth and perspective.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the shadows in the foregrounds of the beach scene grew longer, adding a dramatic effect.

meanings.sent1: The speaker foregrounds the importance of teamwork in achieving success.
meanings.sent2: She always foregrounds the need for kindness in her interactions with others.
meanings.sent3: During the presentation, he humorously foregrounds the benefits of taking coffee breaks for productivity.
meanings.sent4: The artist skillfully foregrounds the contrast between light and dark in his paintings.
meanings.sent5: The coach foregrounds the significance of practice in improving performance on the field.
